paragraph.paragraph: Debugging is the process of tracing the execution of your project while it is running, to find any bugs that are occurring in the project. This is achieved by stepping through the projects source code, line by line, and comparing the actual execution of the project with the desired execution. When anomalies are found, they cannot be fixed until the debugging process is ended as you must end the debugging in order to edit the source code of the project and recompile. This process will often be repeated until all known bugs are found.

There are many aspects of the Visual Studio .NET Debugger, which EiffelEnvision seamlessly plugs into so you may debug projects written in EiffelEnvision in Visual Studio .NET. The documentation on the Visual Studio .NET debugger, how to use it and all of it facates can be found in the
_asug_How_Do_I_Topics3a_Debugging 0 Using the Debugger documentation.
For information on starting debugger sessions for projects within Visual Studio .NET, please refer to the documentation on vchowExecutionControl 0 Execution Control .
